results.title: Greece: playground of the gods
results.creator_credit: Peter May, Chip Duncan, Crouse Entertainment and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Greece is a land rich in natural beauty, history and tradition; its sun-drenched islands surrounded by sparkling water. Travelling through the countryside exposes the tourist to a wealth of history and and myth; whether it be at the Acropolis, the home of the Gods in Athens or in Crete where the ruins of Knossos and the legendary palace of King Midas can be found. Visit the Plaka where the locals sip Greek coffee and discuss politics and life, see the magnificent windmills of Mykonos and admire some of the finest ancient classical architecture ever constructed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter May, Chip Duncan, Crouse Entertainment and International Video Network

results.title: Paris
results.creator_credit: Valerie Archer, Visa Group and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
A tourist’s guide to the main historical sites, hotels, shopping, nightlife and food of one of the world’s most loved cities - Paris. Includes a segment on the Palace of Versailles.

results.title: Argentina: land of natural wonder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Geographically, Argentina (which is Spanish for “silver”) is the eighth largest country in the world. This colourful guided tour takes us through the highlights of Argentina’s landscape and history. From chilly Tierra del Fuego, the country’s southern-most region, to Aconcagua, the tallest mountain in the western hemisphere. Much of the program is devoted to the sweeping plains of Patagonia, home of the Argentinian cowboy - the gaucho. The video also introduces us to Argentinian wildlife, the beaches of Mar del Plata, the world’s only growing glacier, Perito Mereno and the sights and nightspots of Buenos Aires.

Much of the program is devoted to the sweeping plains of Patagonia, home of the Argentinian cowboy - the gaucho. The video also introduces us to Argentinian wildlife, the beaches of Mar del Plata, the world’s only growing glacier, Perito Mereno and the sights and nightspots of Buenos Aires.

results.title: Singapore: Crossroads of Asia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Travel to exotic Singapore, the ancient trading port poised on the tip of the Malay peninsula that has become a 21st century commercial centre. Stroll across the Padang to admire Parliament House and the Singapore Cricket Club, visit the temple of Heavenly Happiness, Sultan Mosque and Raffles Hotel, home of the Singapore Sling. Shop on Orchard Road, play on Sentosa Island and cap your visit with a tour of Singapore by trishaw.

results.title: How to cope with stress = coping with stress
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video Therapy with Alf Fowles”.
Stress is a normal, everyday part of life. People have different stress thresholds and individuals react to identical stressors to different degrees. British therapist, Alf Fowles, editor of the magazine “Natural Medicine”, explains how stress can affect our lives outlining the warning signs of possible mental breakdown and gives ten coping strategies. A simple self hypnosis technique to reduce stress is demonstrated at the conclusion of the program.

results.title: Story structures: finding the hook
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on video storytelling through the analysis of story structure, telling the story, finding the hook to keep people interested, and visualising the story. It explores the six basic questions which must be answered in a story: Who? What? When? Where? Why? and How?

results.title: Advanced editing
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on advanced editing principles and the editing suite including the Beatcam editing suite, the S-VHS edit bench, how to assemble and insert edits, the mixing of sound including voice overs, graphics, sound effects and sound mixing.

results.title: Visual story telling
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Video tech”.
This program presents a structured look at the practice and technique of video story telling. It looks at the sequencing of shots and how they work to advance a story, the planning of shots, the shooting of a sequence and the placement of the camera when shooting. It focusses on continuity and the factors to watch when editing so that shots will flow from one to the other and not seem illogical in the finished product.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions

results.title: On screen direction
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode examines the process of on-screen direction. It details the technical orchestration of setting up the shoot, camera position, visual sequences needed, actuality shots and the direction of people through constant communication and the defining of roles and functions for all people involved. It also explores the requirements for directing special talent including children and animals, and their special needs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
